definition: to wave (one's hand)
to wave/to brandish/to command/to conduct/to scatter/to disperse
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: Gabriel giggled and waved bye-bye back to him.
sentences.chinese: 盖布瑞尔吃吃的笑著并回以挥手再见的手势。

sentences.english: Professor Lu Yang stood on the plane's entrance and waved good-bye to us.
sentences.chinese: 陆杨教授站在飞机的登机口前向我们挥手告别。
她咧嘴笑着，并挥手致意。

sentences.english: People gathered along the train route to wave to the President-elect.
sentences.chinese: 人们聚集在铁路沿线像候选总统挥手致意。

sentences.english: If you can't get back to the beach, tread water and wave for a lifeguard's help.
sentences.chinese: 假如你无法游回岸边，可踩水并向救生员挥手求救。

sentences.english: The boy waved until it was out of sight.
sentences.chinese: 男孩一直向它挥手，直到看不见为止。

sentences.english: She waved adieu to us from the doorway.
sentences.chinese: 她在门口向我们挥手告别。

sentences.english: He brushed by with a perfunctory wave to the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 他擦身而过，朝人群敷衍地挥了挥手。

sentences.english: Several groups of people were having barbecues in the fields.
sentences.chinese: 野外有几伙人在烧烤，其中有一人挥手招呼我。

sentences.english: That young girl Hun however don't feel, waving hand of a strength son.
sentences.chinese: 那少女浑然未觉，一个劲儿的挥手。

sentences.english: No, he's just shaked his hand to us.
sentences.chinese: 没有，他只是向我们挥手。

sentences.english: Haas waved his hand toward the house.
Ann used to stand at the window and wave goodbye.
sentences.chinese: 安总是要站在窗前挥手送别。
他有气无力地挥了挥手。
船启航时，汤姆挥了挥手。

sentences.english: People are waving farewell to passengers on board.
sentences.chinese: 人们纷纷向已上船的人挥手告别。

definition: to wave/to brandish/to command/to conduct/to scatter/to disperse
to wave/to beckon
to wave one's hand/to gesture with one's hand (beckoning, waving good-bye etc)/to swing one's arms
to hint/to indicate (an idea to sb)
to retire/to withdraw/to retreat/to step down
to turn one's head/to turn around
to turn one's head/to change direction/U-turn/volte face/to repent
nutation (plants turning to face the sun)
to get up/to leave/to set forth
to leave/to walk away/to beat it/to move aside
(of a person) to turn round/to face about/(of a widow) to remarry (archaic)
to yell
to turn one's head/in no time/in the twinkling of an eye
to have a smile on one's face
to get up on hind legs (esp. of horse)/to stand/to spring up
upon seeing this, .../in response, ...
to pout/to stick out one's lips
